member_organisations:
http://ecra-climate.eu/about-us/members 
 
The European Climate Research Alliance is currently financed and supported by nine partners: A partner is one or several research organisation(s) representing one country. Partner countriers are currently (April18): 
 
Germany 
Netherlands 
Italy 
Finland 
Sweden 
Spain 
United Kingdom 
Czech Republic 
Denmark
fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
- following-up of European funding initiatives 
- following-up on H2020 and FP9 activities
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership: In addition to the partners, there are participants and associates. Participants and associates are other researchers or research organisation contributing to the science foci led by the partners.
relevant_communication: - representing climate research and climate researchers of member organisations in Europe
goals__remit: To bring together, expand and optimise expertise in climate research through a bottom-up approach. The initiative is a platform for joint research planning by sharing existing national research capacities and infrastructures. ECRA acts as a unified voice for climate research in Europe.
